Package uk.osgb.algorithm.minkowski_sum

Class Minkowski_Sum

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.osgb.algorithm.minkowski_sum.Minkowski_Sum
  • public class Minkowski_Sum
extends Object
    This is an experimental implementation of Minkowski sum and difference based on JTS geometric functionality.

    Current implementation supports Minkowski sums between a "source" geometry (polygon/linestring/multipolygon/multilinestring/GeometryCollection) and a "reference" geometry (polygon/linestring), and Minkowski difference between a "source" geometry (polygon/multipolygon/GeometryCollection) and a "reference" geometry (polygon/linestring)

    Polygons may be concave. The "source" polygon may contain holes.

    Any holes in "reference" polygon are ignored (in most cases it doesn't make practical sense anyway).

    Author:
    Sheng Zhou, small improvements by Michael Carleton

    • Method Detail

      • compMinkSum

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry compMinkSum​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry src,
                                                             org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry ref,
                                                             boolean doReflection,
                                                             boolean isRefConvex)
        Minkowski sum of two general geometries, dispatched by manually testing types
        Parameters:
        src - source geometry which might be polygon/multipolygon/linestring/multilinestring
        ref - reference geometry, which might be a polygon or a linestring
        doReflection - If reflection over origin is performed first on reference polygon (e.g. for collision detection purpose).
        Returns:
        the sum or an empty polygon (for un-supported types)

      • minkSum

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry minkSum​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry src,
                                                         org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry ref,
                                                         Boolean doReflection,
                                                         Boolean isRefConvex)
        Minkowski sum of two general geometries, using simulated multi-dispatch
        Parameters:
        src - source geometry which might be polygon/multipolygon/linestring/multilinestring
        ref - reference geometry, which might be a polygon or a linestring
        doReflection - If reflection over origin is performed first on reference polygon (e.g. for collision detection purpose).
        isRefConvex - if reference geometry is known to be convex, a small bit of exter performance improvement may be achieved
        Returns:
        minkowski sum of src and ref (or an empty geometry)

      • minkSum

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry minkSum​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry src,
                                                         org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry ref)
        Minkowski sum of two general geometries, computed without any presumption
        Parameters:
        src - source geometry which might be polygon/multipolygon/linestring/multilinestring
        ref - reference geometry, which might be a polygon or a linestring
        Returns:
        minkowski sum of src and ref (or an empty geometry)

      • compMinkSumPlgPlg

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry compMinkSumPlgPlg​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon src,
                                                                   org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon ref,
                                                                   boolean doReflection,
                                                                   boolean isRefConvex)
        Minkowski sum of two polygons. Any holes in reference polygon are ignored
        Parameters:
        src - Source polygon, may contain holes
        ref - Reference polygon, holes are ignored
        doReflection - If reflection is performed first on reference polygon (e.g. for collision detection purpose). For repeated computation, reflection may be performed first before calling this method.
        isRefConvex - whether the reference polygon is convex (if unknown, please use false)
        Returns:

      • compMinkSumMultiPlgPlg

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry compMinkSumMultiPlgPlg​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.MultiPolygon src,
                                                                        org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon ref,
                                                                        boolean doReflection,
                                                                        boolean isRefConvex)
        Minkowski sum of a multipolygon and a polygon
        Parameters:
        src - source multipolygon, may contain holes
        ref - reference polygon, holes are ignored
        doReflection - if reflection is performed first on reference polygon (for repeated computation, reflection may be performed first before calling this method)
        isRefConvex - whether the reference polygon is convex (if unknown, please use false)
        Returns:

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry compMinkDiff​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry src,
                                                              org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry ref,
                                                              boolean isRefSymmetric,
                                                              boolean isRefConvex)
        Minkowski difference of two geometries.
        Parameters:
        src - Source geometry, may be polygon or multipolygon
        ref - Reference geometry, may be polygon or linestring/linearring
        refSymmetric - true if ref is symmetric over origin
        isRefConvex -
        Returns:
        null (not implemented yet)

      • compMinkDiffPlgPlg

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry compMinkDiffPlgPlg​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon src,
                                                                    org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon ref,
                                                                    boolean isRefSymmetric,
                                                                    boolean isRefConvex)
        Minkowski difference of two polygons (src - ref). Holes in ref are ignored.
        Parameters:
        src - Source polygon
        ref - reference polgyon (without hole)
        doReflection - whether ref should be reflected (for repeated calls, ref may be reflected before calling this method). If ref is symmetric with respect to the coordinate origin, there is no need to perform reflection either.
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate[] reflectionOrgCoordArray​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate[] coords)

      • segPlgAddition

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon segPlgAddition​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate[] refCoords,
                                                               org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate segSp,
                                                               org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate segEp,
                                                               boolean isRefConvex,
                                                               org.locationtech.jts.geom.GeometryFactory gf)
        Given a line segment segSp-segEp, and coordinate array of a polygon refCoords, return the point set union of: vector sum of polygon refCoords and segSp; vector sum of polygon refCoords and segEp; all points covered by the polygon when it moves from segSp to segEp
        Parameters:
        refCoords - Coordinate array of the reference polygon (without holes)
        segSp - starting point of the line segment
        segEp - ending point of the line segment
        isRefConvex - if the reference polygon refCoords is convex. If reference polygon is convex, the computation is simplier and robust
        Returns:

      • segLSAddition

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon segLSAddition​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate segSp,
                                                              org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate segEp,
                                                              org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate[] refCoords,
                                                              org.locationtech.jts.geom.GeometryFactory gf)
        vector addition of a segment and a linestring (open, although it will handle linearing as well)
        Parameters:
        refCoords - Coordinate array of the reference linestring (whether it is a ring is checked outside this method)
        segSp -
        segEp -
        Returns:
        the sum (may be an emtpy polygon)

      • coordArrayVectorAddition

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry coordArrayVectorAddition​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate[] geomCoords,
                                                                          org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate[] refCoords,
                                                                          org.locationtech.jts.geom.GeometryFactory gf)
        computing the vector sum of a linestring or polygon (without holes) and a linestring (maybe closed) in form of coordinate array.
        Parameters:
        geomCoords - Coordinate array of source geometry (linestring, or polygon without holes)
        refCoords - Coordinate array of reference geometry, an open linestring or a closed lienarring
        Returns:
